name: Adult Bronze Dragon
description: The Adult Bronze Dragon has shimmering bronze scales, crest-like horns, and a powerful, proud appearance. It's often associated with coastal regions and possesses the ability to breathe both air and water.
memorable: This dragon commands respect with its mastery over lightning, ability to manipulate water, and its role as a guardian of coastal realms.
goals: The dragon typically seeks to protect coastal regions, uphold justice, and combat threats to aquatic life and communities.
relations: Adult Bronze Dragons may ally with good-aligned adventurers or serve as protectors to aquatic and coastal creatures.
environment: Commonly found near coastlines and large bodies of water.
strengths: Possesses strong melee attacks, a devastating breath weapon, the ability to control water, and formidable innate spellcasting.
weaknesses: Although tough, its reliance on maintaining higher AC may make it vulnerable to high damage output.
attacks: Bite and claw attacks are its primary melee options, supplemented by powerful breath weapons and a tail attack capable of pushing enemies away.
most_powerful_ability: Lightning Breath, which unleashes a devastating line of electricity, can incapacitate or severely injure multiple foes.
senses: The dragon has blindsight up to 60 feet and a passive perception of 22, allowing it to detect hidden enemies effectively.
skills: It excels in Insight and Perception, both with modifiers of +8, demonstrating its awareness and discernment capabilities.
additional_information: Innate spellcasting includes fog cloud, speak with animals, commune with nature, and speak with plants.
Legendary Resistance allows the dragon to ignore failed saving throws three times per day.
Can change its shape into a humanoid or beast form.
Frightful Presence can instill fear in nearby creatures.
The Oracle of the Coast ability grants it the power to predict weather and cast scrying.
spellcasting: Can innately cast spells related to nature and water, enhancing its versatility.
